text: To be specific, we need more parks and better streetscapes. “Green space” is a non-word that anti-density advocates use to defend lawns and detached housing from redevelopment.

text: Seating is available throughout Denver parks—w/6K+ acres of urban parks/parkways/nat. areas, DPR facilities do provide respite from the city. text: While there isn't residential immediately adjacent to it, about a 5 min bike ride or 10-15 minute walk along the Platte there is residential. The size and natural features of the area also make it appealing to naturists, birders, and other who come from farther away.

Join us tomorrow for the 1st public meeting for the GVR Indoor Pool Project with @denverparksrec 

We want to hear your ideas and suggestions and hope we see you there!

text: I will say it again. I don’t intentionally set out to harm living creatures. And I get my protein straight from the source, not second hand from slaughtered animals.....
text_html: I will say it again. I don’t intentionally set out to harm living creatures. And I get my protein straight from the source, not second hand from slaughtered animals.....

text: But you choose to drive, deliberately killing dozens or hundreds of insects every time you do. But I know veganism is just a hobby, not a core belief, or you wouldn’t use a car powered by gasoline produced from animal decay.

text: About 30 years ago, my son and I were driving back from Kansas to our house in Park Hill. Despite the firework ban, we drove through smoke, small grass fires, the explosions of cherry bombs, M80s, and the occasional bottle rocket. It reminded me of Ft. Apache, the Bronx.

text: I can testify from personal experience that radar guns were first employed by police  to “monitor” cyclist’s speeds back in the 1980s in Wash Park. At the time, more of the park was closed off to cars, so there were spontaneous mini criteriums & group rides on Summer evenings.

text: Many desire paths lead people near away from crosswalks, causing safety concerns. Additionally, undesignated trails can impact park resources through trampling/loss of vegetation, soil compaction, destabilization, erosion &  creation of pathways for invasive plants.
